    The building official is responsible for the administration of this article dealing with post-construction controls on new development and significant redevelopment, the issuance of storm water quality permits required by this article, the enforcement of this article and maintaining proper records. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-234-14-250. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - STORM WATER QUALITY PERMIT PROCESS 

Sec. 14-251. - Permits required. 
    All new development and significant redevelopment occurring within the city's drainage area in the Woodlands Urbanized Area as defined by the United States Environmental Protection Agency and recognized by the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality without first securing a SWQ permit, or submitting an industrial activity certification in accordance with section 14-254 of this article is prohibited. If any portion of a project drains directly into a municipal separate storm sewer system owned by the city or located within the city's drainage area, that project must have a SWQ permit issued by the city. The granting of a SWQ permit does not imply that federal or state storm water management criteria have been met and is in addition to any other development permit required by law. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-252. - Duration. 
    The SWQ permit shall expire one year from the date the storm water quality features, created pursuant to a storm water quality management plan, receive final approval for operation, but may be renewed. Final approval for operation occurs upon the issuance of a certificate of compliance by the city's building department pursuant to subsection 14-312(b) of this article. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-253. - Applicability. 
    Except as provided in section 14-251 above, the requirements to obtain a SWQ permit shall not apply to new development involving any of the following: 
(1)  Any project that has, prior to May 1, 2012 of this article, received a completed and unexpired application for a preliminary or final subdivision plat on file with the city, provided the project is substantially underway by August 1, 2012; 
(2)  Any project that has an initial construction plan review from the city by May 1, 2012, or in the case of a project not receiving an initial construction plan review, has submitted a valid application for approval of plan to the city by May 1, 2012, provided the project is substantially underway by August 1, 2012; 
(3)  For city channel or detention basin projects, if the date of authorization or notice to proceed from the city to the contractor is issued prior to August 1, 2012; or 
(4)  Linear projects such as underground pipelines, utilities, or drainage where the resulting impervious surface is limited to less than one acre. For this exemption, plans and drawings showing the total resultant impervious surface must be submitted to the city's building department. Any future extensions or changes to the impervious surface shall be counted toward the one-acre threshold. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-254. - Industrial activity certification. 
    If new development or significant redevelopment occurs at a facility that either has or will have permit coverage for storm water discharges associated with industrial activity issued by the TCEQ, the operator shall submit an industrial activity certification on a form prescribed and approved by the city's building department. An industrial activity certification shall also include any of the following: 
(1)  A copy of the application for an individual permit from the TCEQ or EPA for storm water discharges associated with industrial activity at the facility; 
(2)  A copy of the permit issued by the TCEQ or EPA for storm water discharges associated with industrial activity at the facility; 
(3)  A copy of the NOI for coverage under a general permit for storm water discharges associated with industrial activity issued by the TCEQ, or a non-exposure certification issued by the city's building department; 
(4)  A statement of commitment to file an application for an individual permit from the TCEQ for storm water discharges associated with industrial activity at the facility; or 
(5)  A statement of commitment to file a NOI for coverage under a general permit for storm water discharges associated with industrial activity issued by the TCEQ. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-255. - Application. 
    The application for a storm water quality permit shall be on a form prescribed and approved by the city's building department and shall be supported by the following: 
(1)  A complete set of construction plans including a storm water quality management plan, which must be approved by the city's building department under division 3 of this article; 
(2)  A fee in the amount of $300.00 paid in cash, cashier's check, personal check, or money order. Checks shall be made out to "City of Oak Ridge North;" 
(3)  If a maintenance contract is required by this Code for the approval and acceptance of plans and drainage, a copy of the maintenance contract shall be submitted with the application; 
(4)  A copy of the NOI to discharge storm water associated with construction activity submitted or to be submitted to the EPA or TCEQ; and 
(5)  One of the following to demonstrate proof or ownership and maintenance responsibility where appropriate: 
a.  A copy of a letter from a drainage district, a municipal utility district, a public utility district, a water control and improvement district, or any other utility or water district created pursuant to state law; 
b.  A copy of creation documents from a property owners association; or 
c.  Documents from individual owners. 
(6)  An affidavit to the public in a form and containing the statements prescribed by the city's building department that has been recorded in accordance with section 14-313 of this article. 
    The city's building department may require the submission of additional information, drawings, specifications or documents to determine whether a SWQ permit shall be issued from the information submitted. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-256. - Determination of permit eligibility. 
    After the application is filed, the city's building department shall: 
(1)  Issue the SWQ permit if the city engineer is satisfied that that applicant has met all the requirements of section 14-255 above; or 
(2)  Return the application and supporting data to the applicant if any provision of this article is not met. The city's building department shall notify the applicant in writing of items required for further review of the plans. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-257. - Permit renewal. 
    Storm water quality permits shall be renewed annually. The date of renewal shall be the anniversary date the storm water quality features received final approval for operation pursuant to section 14-312 hereof. Failure to renew the SWQ permit before this date means the permit expires, and the person must reapply for a SWQ permit as required by section 14-252 above. To renew a SWQ permit the following items must be submitted: 
(1)  A permit renewal form as prescribed and approved by the city's building department; 
(2)  A certificate of proper operation completed by the owner or owner's agent; 
(3)  On all projects that involve any structural controls, a certification completed by a professional engineer licensed in this state that all such controls conform to the plans and technical specifications in the SWQMP; and 
(4)  A renewal fee in the amount of $150.00, together with any outstanding inspection or other fee paid in cash, cashier's check, personal check, or money order. Checks shall be made payable to "City of Oak Ridge North." 
    All outstanding inspection or other fees owed the city shall be paid prior to renewal of the SWQ permit. The city shall not renew a SWQ permit if any such fees are outstanding. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-258. - Term of permits. 
    Development activity under the SWQ permit must start within 180 days from the date of issuance. Failure to initiate development activity shall result in the invalidation of the SWQ permit. Upon written request, the city's building department may grant two six-month extensions. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-259-14-270. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 3. - STORM WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLANS 

Sec. 14-271. - Plan approval required. 
    Before the city's building department shall approve a SWQ permit, a storm water quality management plan must be submitted to and approved by the city's building department. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-272. - Plan approval process. 
    The storm water quality management plan shall be submitted as follows: 
(1)  The SWQMP shall be prepared in accordance with the Harris County, Texas Storm Water Management Handbook for Construction Activities and the Harris County, Texas Storm Water Quality Management Guidance Manual or the Harris County, Texas Storm Water Quality Guidance Document for New Development/Redevelopment Projects. If applicable to the BMP selected, the SWQMP shall incorporate features from the minimum design criteria for implementation of certain best management practices for storm water runoff treatment options as set forth in Appendix A. Alternate techniques and methods not mentioned in the Storm Water Quality Management Guidance Manual, Storm Water Quality Guidance Document for New Development/Redevelopment Projects, Storm Water Management Handbook for Construction Activities, or the minimum design criteria for implementation of certain best management practices for storm water runoff treatment options shall be reviewed on a case by-case basis. 
(2)  A preliminary set of drawings shall be submitted to the city's building department for initial review. If a site has storm water discharges associated with construction activity then a preliminary set of drawings and a SWPPP shall be submitted. The review will be conducted in conjunction with the review for compliance with the Regulations of Harris County, Texas, for Flood Plain Management; Regulations of Harris County, Texas, for Driveways and Culverts and the Harris County Flood Control Criteria Manual. Construction control measures including applicable standard drawings shall be included in the submittal. Once reviewed, the drawings shall be returned to the applicant with comments. 
(3)  Any preliminary drawings or plans altered or marked by the storm water quality engineer shall be resubmitted along with the corrected original drawings for signature. If further corrections are required, the package shall be returned to the applicant for re-submittal upon completion of revisions. 
(4)  Drawings shall meet the same standards as far as size, line weight, etc., as outlined in the Rules, Regulations and Requirements Relating to the Approval and Acceptance of Improvements in Subdivisions or re-subdivisions and/or the Harris County Flood Control Criteria Manual. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-273. - Plan amendment process. 
    The storm water quality management plan may be amended by resubmitting the plan to the city's building department for review in accordance with the procedures for initial plan approval set forth in section 14-272 above. If the plan change involves an amendment to the design of any previously approved structural control, a fee shall be charged in accordance with division 9 hereof for review and processing of the amendment and issuance of an amended permit. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-274-14-290. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 4. - OWNERSHIP AND MAINTENANCE OF THE STORM WATER QUALITY FEATURES 

Sec. 14-291. - Ownership and maintenance. 
    Ownership and maintenance of the storm water quality features designed and built pursuant to section 14-272 of the article shall be according to the following: 
(1)  The storm water quality features shall remain with the owner unless there is a transfer pursuant to section 14-314 hereof. 
(2)  If the city accepts the storm water quality features for maintenance, the permit holder's requirements for the SWQ permit and permit renewal with respect to that feature as set forth in sections 14-252 and 14-258 terminate. All other permit requirements continue to apply. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-292-14-310. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 5. - PERMITTEE RESPONSIBILITIES 

Sec. 14-311. - Responsibilities of all permittees. 
    All permittees shall: 
(1)  Comply with the SWQMP; 
(2)  Remove all soil deposits resulting from runoff or from vehicular construction traffic and/or from site operations from the road adjacent roadside ditch on a daily or more frequent basis, or as specified in the storm water quality management plan; 
(3)  Post the SWQ permit on the job site in a place visible from the nearest road or street during the construction phase; and 
(4)  Allow the city's building department to inspect the work pursuant to a permit. The city engineer or designated inspector may make as many scheduled or unscheduled inspections as he may deem necessary to enforce this article and shall have access to any building or premise at any reasonable time. If no specific inspection standards are set by any part of this article the inspection shall only be to determine that the drawings and specifications furnished with the SWQ permit application are met. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-312. - Certifications and inspections. 
    All storm water quality features shall be constructed in accordance with the plans approved by the city's building department. Permittees shall inspect and certify that its storm water quality features are constructed and operated according to submitted plans as follows: 
(1)  When the storm water quality features are complete and ready for use, a professional engineer licensed in this state must inspect and certify that the storm water quality features were completed in accordance with the approved plans. The permittee shall then submit an as-built certification form supplied by the city's building department. The form must be completed, signed, and sealed by a professional engineer licensed in this state indicating that the storm water quality features were completed in accordance with the approved plans. 
(2)  Once the as-built certification and any certification authorized by the SWQMP are submitted to the city's building department, the city's building department will issue or deny a certificate of compliance. Should the city's building department determine that the applicable certifications were not provided, or the provisions of section 14-257 of this article were not followed, then enforcement procedures, such as SWQ permit revocation or civil enforcement, may commence. The city's building department may deny a certificate of non-compliance if he determines that the storm water quality features were not constructed in accordance with approved plans. 
(3)  Should the city's building department have to make additional inspections or conduct survey work due to non-compliance with this article, additional fees may be assessed as outlined in division 9 hereof. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-313. - Recordation. 
    Recordation of the obligation to comply with the storm water quality permit requirements shall be in the form of an affidavit to the public as prescribed by the city's building department according to the following: 
(1)  The obligation to comply with the SWQ permit requirements shall be recorded by the permittee in the county real property records for the affected parcel and will apply to all subsequent owners of all or a portion of the parcel. The recordation shall note that no structural or non-structural controls on, or for the parcel, may be changed from the plans and technical specifications in the SWQ permit for the parcel. If there are substantial changes in the structural or non-structural controls, then the procedures as outlined in section 14-273 of this article shall be followed. For storm water quality features that are not accepted by the city for maintenance, the recordation shall reflect that the features are private and must be properly maintained by the owner in accordance with the SWQMP. 
(2)  For new development that includes the platting of a reserve tract, a notation shall be placed on the subdivision plat that a SWQ permit must be obtained before the issuance of any development permit for a structure on all or a part of the reserve tract. 
(3)  Third-party permittees. For subdivisions involving a property owners association, the agreement shall be recorded for all parcels in the subdivision. For other new development or significant redevelopment for which there is a third-party permit fee, the third-party agreement shall be recorded for all parcels subject to the rights and obligations specified in the agreement at the time of the transfer of the SWQ permit to the third-party permittee. 
(4)  The applicant, or if the SWQ permit has already been issued, the permittee, shall pay all recording fees required by the city. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-314. - Transfer. 
    A permittee may transfer its storm water quality permit in accordance with the following: 
(1)  The SWQ permit may be held by an entity or person other than the landowner if the entity or person and the landowner enter into a binding legal agreement that meets the requirements of this section. The entity or person must agree to comply with the requirements of this article and with the terms and conditions of the SWQ permit, including adherence to the operation and maintenance requirements specified in division 4 hereof. 
(2)  The third-party agreement shall grant fee simple title to all structural controls to the entity or person, provide an easement if necessary to allow access by the entity or person across the landowner's property to maintain structural controls or to implement non-structural controls, and if necessary, to allow storm water from the landowner's property to drain across any adjacent property to a designated structural control. The legal agreement shall also provide that in the event of its termination for any reason, including either by choice or by default, the obligation to comply with the provisions of this section shall revert to the landowner. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-315-14-330. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 6. - SUSPENSION AND REVOCATION OF STORM WATER QUALITY PERMITS 

Sec. 14-331. - Suspension of permits. 
    SWQ permit suspensions are handled in accordance with the following provisions: 
(1)  A SWQ permit is suspended when the city's building department or inspector advises the permittee or some responsible person on the job that the SWQ permit is suspended and posts a written suspension notice over the SWQ permit at the jobsite. 
(2)  The following actions by the permittee are grounds for suspension of a SWQ permit: 
a.  Non-compliance with divisions 3 or 5 of this article; 
b.  Deviations from drawings and specifications filed with the city's building department and refusing to make corrections required by the city's building department; or 
c.  Any grounds for revocation of a SWQ permit as outlined in section 14-332 hereof. 
(3)  When the suspension notice is posted, the permittee must immediately suspend all work on the job except that work necessary to abate the suspension. The suspension will be abated when the corrective work has been performed and has passed inspection. The abatement will be evidenced by the removal of the suspension notice by the city's building department or his inspector and a notation on the permit notice by the city's building department or his inspector that the work has now been re-inspected and passed. The suspension notice may not be removed by any person other than the city's building department or his inspector and removal by any other person will be ineffective. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-332. - Permit revocation. 
    A storm water quality permit shall be revoked after notice and opportunity for a hearing pursuant to section 14-333 of this article if any of the following occur: 
(1)  Material deviation from the drawings and specifications on file with city's building department, including the SWPPP, or a pattern of consistent deviation from such drawings and specifications, which would demonstrate an intention to avoid conformity with the requirements of the SWQ permit; 
(2)  Refusal to uncover work for a mandatory inspection; 
(3)  Removal of a permit suspension notice; 
(4)  Proceeding with work while a permit is suspended, other than such work necessary to abate a suspension; 
(5)  An act or acts of violence, or threat or threats of violence, against city's building department or inspector either on or off the job for the purpose of intimidating the city's building department, inspector, engineer, or other individual working on the city's behalf so the individual will not perform his/her inspection duties; 
(6)  Falsifying information in the SWQ permit application; 
(7)  Failing to submit all required certifications as outlined in section 14-312 hereof; or 
(8)  Consistent violation of the NPDES or TPDES permit for the project during construction, including failure to correct deficiencies noted during construction phase inspections. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-333. - Permit revocation procedures. 
    Storm water quality permits shall be revoked in the following manner: 
(1)  The city's building department shall file a complaint stating the reason for SWQ permit revocation with the city council. 
(2)  The city council will set a hearing as soon as practicable, but within 30 days. 
(3)  The city's building department will deliver the original complaint and hearing notice to the city council and designate an appropriate person as serving agent, and give two copies to the serving agent. 
(4)  The serving agent will take the two copies of the complaint and hearing notice to the site where the agent will: 
a.  Hand one copy of the complaint and hearing notice to the permittee; 
b.  If the permittee is not an individual or cannot be found on the site, the serving agent will hand one copy of the complaint and hearing notice to the person on the site who appears to be in charge; or 
c.  If no person can be found on the site, the serving agent will post the complaint and hearing notice over the SWQ permit and/or notice of suspension posted at the job. Upon posting of the complaint and hearing notice, the SWQ permit shall be suspended. 
(5)  The serving agent will fill in the return on the remaining copy, noting on it the date, time and manner in which the agent perfected service, and sign the return and return the remaining copy to the city's building department. 
(6)  At the time set for hearing, if the return copy of the complaint has been returned to the city's building department by the serving agent, and reflects that service has been perfected, the city council may proceed with the hearing. 
(7)  Hearings will be conducted by the city council in the manner provided for by section 14-352 of this article. The city council's decision and is governed by sections 14-353 and 14-354 hereof. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-334-14-350. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 7. - APPEALS AND HEARING PROCEDURES, VARIANCES, AND REVIEW BY CITY COUNCIL 

Sec. 14-351. - Appeals. 
    If a permit applicant is denied a SWQ permit or has its SWQ permit suspended, the applicant may appeal the denial or suspension as provided in this section. The term "appellant" is used to refer to the appealing party. An appellant must seek a remedy under this procedure before seeking any remedy in court. Application for a permit is deemed to be a waiver of the right to challenge this article before exhausting remedies herein provided. The appeals process is as follows: 
(1)  Appeals are initiated by the making of a complaint with or by requesting an exception to this article from the city council in writing. 
(2)  The city council will set a time for a hearing, which will be scheduled as soon as practicable but within 30 days of the receipt of the written complaint or request, and shall prepare a notice of public hearing stating the time and date of the hearing. Copies shall be distributed as follows: 
a.  The original copy and will be filed with the city council and the city's building department will prepare a file for the hearing notice. 
b.  The city's building department will give one copy to the appellant. 
c.  The hearing will be conducted as provided in section 14-352 hereof. 
(3)  Appeal of a suspension will not abate the suspension pending the decision of the city council. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-352. - Hearing before city council. 
    At hearings before the city council, the city council will hear the testimony of the city's building department and any witnesses called by the city's building department. The city council will hear the testimony of the appellant and any witnesses called by the appellant. The city council will review all documents and exhibits submitted by the parties. The city council will not be bound by formal rules of evidence and will control the evidence reserving the power to exclude testimony or exhibits the city council does not consider relevant. The city council will maintain an accurate record of the evidence adduced at the hearing. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-353. - Filing of city council's decision. 
    The city council will prepare a written decision within three working days after the hearing. A copy of the decision will be filed with the city's building department, and the original will be sent to the appellant's address shown on the SWQ permit or application. If a variance is granted, the city's building department shall prepare the appropriate permit with any special requirements that may be required by the conditions of the variance. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-354. - Variances. 
    If any person wishes an exception to any provision of this article, he or she shall request a variance in the manner prescribed for the filing of an appeal by section 14-351 above with the city council. The city council shall hold a hearing, and deny or grant the variance. Variances will be granted only if the conditions below are met: 
(1)  The applicant has shown good and sufficient cause; 
(2)  It has been determined that failure to grant the variance would result in an exceptional hardship to the applicant; and 
(3)  The granting of a variance will not result in a pollutant discharge, additional threats to public safety, extraordinary public expense, or create nuisances, cause fraud or victimization of the public. 
    Economic hardship shall not constitute the sole basis for granting a variance. A hearing before the city council regarding variances shall be requested in the manner provided in section 14-351 of this article. If a variance is granted, a SWQ permit shall be issued, and the permittee shall conform to all applicable provisions of this article, except the section or sections for which a variance is granted. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-355-14-370. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 8. - FORMS AND RECORDS 

Sec. 14-371. - Forms and records. 
    Forms to be used in the administration of this article shall be provided and approved by the city's building department. All forms shall be available at the city's building department and may be amended or supplanted from time to time by the city's building department. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-372-14-390. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 9. - FEES 

Sec. 14-391. - Fees. 
    Fees for SWQ permits and inspections are to be set by the city council. Fees shall be paid by cash, cashier's check, money order, or personal check. Should the check be returned for insufficient funds, the SWQ permit issued becomes invalid. Fees shall be paid at the time the SWQ permit is delivered to the permittee unless the city has approved other arrangements. The following fee schedule applies to actions under this article: 
Initial permit $300.00 Yearly permit renewal fee 150.00 Inspection/reinspection fee 65.00 Certificate of compliance 100.00 Certificate of non-compliance 100.00  
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-392-14-410. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 10. - PENALTIES 

Sec. 14-411. - Civil penalties. 
    Any person violating any provisions of this article or failing to observe any provisions hereof shall be subject to a penalty not to exceed the jurisdiction of a justice court as provided by V.T.C.A., Government Code § 27.031, currently $5,000.00, and each violation shall constitute a separate offense. Furthermore, each day that a breach of any provision hereof continues shall be considered a separate breach. Such penalties shall be in addition to any other penalties provided by the laws of this state. In all suits to enforce its rules, the city shall seek to recover reasonable fees for attorneys, expert witnesses and other costs incurred by the city before the court. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-412. - Additional remedies. 
    In addition to proceeding under authority of section 14-411 of this division, the city is entitled to pursue all other criminal and civil remedies to which it is entitled under authority of statutes or other ordinances against a person responsible for illicit discharges, illicit connections, or unauthorized connections. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-413. - Payment of additional costs. 
    The city, in its discretion, may require any person violating any provisions of this article to pay all costs or damages resulting from such violations, including the costs of clean up, fines imposed by any regulatory body with jurisdiction. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-414. - Notice of adoption. 
    Notice of the adoption of these rules and regulations and of the penalties therein provided shall be given by publication in a newspaper as provided by law. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-415-14-430. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 11. - MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS 

Sec. 14-431. - Non-waiver. 
    The failure on the part of the city to enforce any article, section, clause, sentence or provision of this article shall not constitute a waiver of the right of the city later to enforce any article, section, clause, sentence or provision of this article. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-432. - Validity. 
    All provisions of city ordinances or regulations in conflict herewith are hereby repealed. The validity of any article, section, clause, sentence or provision of this article shall not affect the validity of any other part of this article, which can be given effect without the invalidated part or parts. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-433. - Severability. 
    If any provision, article, section or paragraph of this article is invalidated by any court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions, articles, sections and paragraphs shall not be affected and shall continue in full force and effect. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-434, 14-435. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XIV. - LAWN IRRIGATION 

Sec. 14-436. - Permit required. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to install, alter, or modify an irrigation system without first obtaining an irrigation permit through the community development department. 
(1)  Exceptions. This section does not apply to on-site sewage treatment facilities that are governed by other applicable laws; agricultural irrigation systems and; irrigation systems that are supplied solely by a private water well that is owned and operated by the irrigation system's owner for domestic use. 
(b)  Each person desiring to secure an irrigation permit must be registered with the city as a licensed irrigator. All of the following information must be submitted to register as a licensed irrigator: 
(1)  A valid photo identification card. 
(2)  State irrigator's license. 
(3)  General liability insurance policy in the amount of $300,000.00. 
(4)  Exception. Persons qualifying under Article 8751 of the Texas Revised Civil Statutes, need not be registered as a licensed irrigator. 
(c)  After satisfying paragraph (b) above, a person may secure a permit upon submittal, and city approval of the following information: 
(1)  A completed irrigation permit application. 
(2)  Two copies of the irrigation plans. The irrigation plans must be drawn to scale and must include: the irrigator's seal, signature, and date of the signing; major physical features and boundaries of the areas to be irrigated; a North arrow; a legend; zone flow measurements for each zone; location and type of controllers and sensors; location, type, and size of water sources, backflow prevention device, water emission device, valve, pressure regulation component, and main line and lateral piping; scale used; and design pressure. 
(3)  Permit fee as set forth in schedule of fees. 
(d)  A copy of the permit must be posted on the job site in a conspicuous location at all times during the installation of the system. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-437. - Materials, methods, and design requirements. 
(a)  The following materials are hereby approved: 
(1)  Sch. 40 PVC pipe or better must be used from the point of connection to the potable water supply, up to the backflow device. 
(2)  SDR 21 PVC pipe or better may be used for other main lines and laterals. 
(b)  The following methods are hereby approve and shall be used when installing, altering, or modifying an irrigation system: 
(1)  All PVC joints shall be the cement solvent type with purple primer. Pipe cleaner, and/or clear primer will not be accepted. 
(2)  All exposed piping must be insulated, secured, and protected from ultra-violet light deterioration. 
(3)  Irrigation components shall not be used in excess of the manufacture's published performance limitations. 
(4)  New systems shall not use, and existing systems shall not be modified to use, above-ground spray emission devices in landscapes that are bordered on two or more sides and are less than 48 inches in length or width (not including impervious surfaces). Narrow paved walkways, jogging paths, and similar areas located cemeteries, parks, golf courses, or other public areas may be exempted if the runoff drains into a landscaped area. 
(5)  Pop-up spray heads used in new irrigation systems must be direct flow away from a hardscape and shall not be installed closer than four inches from a hardscape. 
(6)  Irrigation zones shall be based on material type, microclimate factors, topographic features, soil conditions, and hydrological requirements. 
(7)  Spray heads shall be arranged such that they do not spray water on or over any impervious material. 
(8)  All systems shall be designed, installed, maintained, altered, repaired, serviced, and operated in a manner that promotes water conservation. 
(9)  All piping from the point of connection, up to the backflow device, must be buried a minimum of 12 inches. All other main lines and laterals shall be buried a minimum of six inches in depth. 
(10)  A licensed irrigator or licensed irrigator technician must be present on the site during the entire irrigation installation. 
(11)  All new irrigation installations shall be equipped with a rain or moisture shut-off device or other technology. Such devices or technology shall be designed and installed to inhibit or interrupt operation of the irrigation system during periods of moisture or rainfall. Repairs to existing irrigation system that require the replacement of an existing controller, must be retrofitted with the same rain or moisture shut-off device. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-438. - Reclaimed water. 
    Reclaimed water may be used in landscape irrigation systems if: 
(1)  There is no direct contact with edible crops, unless the crop is pasteurized before consumption; 
(2)  The irrigation system does not spray water across property lines that do not belong to the irrigation system's owner; 
(3)  The irrigation system is installed using purple piping and components; 
(4)  The irrigation system is not cross connected with a potable water source and; 
(5)  A minimum of an eight-inch by eight-inch sign, in English and Spanish, is prominently posted on/in the area that is being irrigated, that reads "RECLAIMED WATER - DO NOT DRINK" and "AGUA DE RECUPERACION - NO BEBER". 
(6)  A high hazard RPZD (reduced pressure zone device) is stalled on the customer's domestic line after the water meter. Such high hazard RPZDs shall be tested and maintained annually in accordance with the International Plumbing Code as adopted by the city. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-439. - Backflow device required. 
(a)  All irrigation systems shall have a backflow device installed that protects the potable source water supply from cross contamination. 
(b)  The backflow device must be a pressure vacuum breaker (PVB), reduced pressure zone (RPZ), or double check valve (DC) backflow device. For systems where chemicals are induced, or a health hazard exists, an RPZ is the only device allowed. 
(c)  A PVB must be installed such that the elevation of the bottom of the device is at least one foot above the highest sprinkler head. An RPZ and DC must be installed a minimum of 12 inches above grade in an accessible box. The box shall be large enough to accommodate testing of the device without removal. 
(d)  The backflow device must be tested by a licensed certified tester upon installation and prior to the system being placed in service and annually thereafter. 
(e)  The backflow device must be secured and protected in accordance with subsection 14-437(b)(2). 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-440. - Inspections. 
(a)  All inspections must be requested 24 hours in advance. 
(b)  A copy of the backflow device test report must be attached to the backflow device and available at the time of the piping inspection. 
(c)  The piping from the point of connection up to the backflow device, shall be inspected and approved by the building official or his designee, prior to covering the piping system. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 14-441. - Penalties. 
(a)  Any person violating any provision of this article shall, upon conviction, be fined in an amount not to exceed $500.00 as provide by section 1-4 of this Code. 
(b)  Each violation and each day a violation of this article exists shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 14-442-14-445. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE XV. - FENCES[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, adopted Oct. 14, 2013, repealed the former Art. XV and enacted a new article as set out herein. The former Art. XV, §§ 14-446-14-454, pertained to similar subject matter and derived from Ord. No. 42-2012, § 1, adopted Nov. 19, 2012. 

Sec. 14-446. - Scope. 
    This article shall be known, and may be recited as the fence ordinance of the city. The provisions of this article shall apply to all fences and barriers, as the terms are defined herein, within the city limits of the city. 
(Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, 10-14-13) 
Sec. 14-447. - Definitions. 
    The following definitions shall apply to this article: 
    Commercial outdoor storage area means a property or portion of property that's exclusive function is dedicated to the outdoor storage of vehicles, machinery, pipe, equipment, and other related goods. 
    Fence shall mean any fence structure designed, built or erected, or constructed, to form a barrier or to mark a boundary or any piece of work artificially built up or composed of parts joined together in some definite manner, which can be made of pressure treated wood, redwood, cedar wood, chain link fence materials, masonry, wrought iron, metal, vinyl, or a combination thereof. 
(Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, 10-14-13) 
Sec. 14-448. - Prohibited fencing. 
(a)  A fence extending into any street right-of-way or other public property. 
(b)  A fence located at the intersection of two public streets extending into the visibility triangle. Such visibility triangle shall mean at least 45 feet from the curb line or edge of the street pavement where no curb exists. 
(c)  Electrically charged fences. 
Exception: Pet barrier fencing installed underground. 
(d)  Barbed wire fences. 
Exception: Commercial and business establishments with a fence height of six feet or more may have barbed wire at the fence top in the following zoning districts: M-1 and M-2. 
(e)  A fence that encloses any fire hydrant, fire sprinkler system control valve, any gas meter, electrical meter or water meter. 
Exception: A gas meter and electrical meter serving a single-family residence only may be enclosed by a fence when such meter is located in the rear or side yard of such single-family residence. 
(f)  A fence with one or more of the following conditions: 
(1)  Insect infestation. 
(2)  Rotten, broken, loose, or missing boards. 
(3)  Structural failure on any fence as determined by the building official. 
(4)  Loose or broken chain link fencing. 
(5)  Fences that are not in the vertical position or that pose a threat of collapse. 
(g)  Fencing constructed forward of the front façade of the house or garage, including a corner lot. 
(h)  Fencing constructed forward of the front façade of a commercial building, including a corner lot, unless such fence is used to protect products that are for sale and displayed outside in accordance with the zoning district requirements in Appendix A. In such case, the fence shall be constructed of wrought iron. 
(Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, 10-14-13) 
Sec. 14-449. - Required fencing. 
(a)  Fencing is required for all property boundaries that abut the R-1 zoning district. Such fence shall be a minimum of eight feet in height and shall serve as an opaque barrier. 
(b)  Commercial outdoor storage areas that can be viewed from a public right-of-way or city owned property. Such fence shall be a minimum of six feet in height. 
(c)  Any fencing required by Chapter 14, Chapter 70, or Appendix A of this Code. 
(d)  All trash bins, recycle bins, receptacles, or dumpsters shall be screened from view. The fence shall be constructed of wood, brick, masonry, stucco, stone, or a combination thereof. Such fence shall be a minimum of six feet in height. 
(1)  Single-family residential dwellings are exempt from the requirements of subsection (d). 
(Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, 10-14-13) 
Sec. 14-450. - Approved materials for construction. 
    The following materials are approved for construction of a fence: 
(1)  Wood fencing provided the following conditions are met: 
a.  Wood fences shall not exceed nine feet in height. 
b.  Wood fences shall have the pickets facing outward if the fence can be viewed from a public right-of-way or city owned property. 
c.  Wood fences may be protected with a transparent water sealant or transparent stain. White paint may be used for picket fences. 
d.  Fencing adjacent to public right-of-ways shall be uniform in height. There shall be no more than a five percent difference in finished height if the fence is continuous with adjacent properties. 
(2)  Chain link fencing provided the following conditions are met: 
a.  Chain link fences shall be of galvanized material, including all component parts thereof. 
b.  Chain link fences shall not exceed nine feet in height. 
c.  Chain link fences cannot be viewed from a public right-of-way or city owned property. 
(3)  Metal fencing provided the following conditions are met: 
a.  The fence shall be primed and painted. 
b.  The fence shall not exceed nine feet in height. 
c.  Fencing adjacent to public rights-of-way shall be uniform in height. There shall be no more than a five percent difference in finished height if the fence is continuous with adjacent properties. 
(4)  Vinyl fencing provided the following conditions are met: 
a.  The vinyl fence is installed in accordance with the manufacturer's installation recommendations. 
b.  The vinyl fence does not exceed nine feet in height. 
c.  Fencing adjacent to public right-of-ways shall be uniform in height. There shall be no more than a five percent difference in finished height if the fence is continuous with adjacent properties. 
(5)  Brick, masonry, stucco, or stone fencing provided the following conditions are met: 
a.  The fence shall be engineer designed. 
b.  The fence cannot be located within an easement. 
c.  The fence shall not exceed nine feet in height. 
d.  Fencing adjacent to public rights-of-way shall be uniform in height. There shall be no more than a five percent difference in finished height if the fence is continuous with adjacent properties. 
(Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, 10-14-13) 
Sec. 14-451. - Penalties. 
(a)  Any person violating any provision or failing to observe any provision of this division shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be fined any sum not more than $500.00. 
(b)  Each and every day or fraction of a day which this division or any part thereof shall be violated shall be deemed a separate offense and punishable as such. 
(Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, 10-14-13) 
Sec. 14-452. - Nonconforming fences. 
    Compliance regulations for nonconforming fencing. It is the declared purpose of this section that nonconforming fencing be eliminated and be required to comply with the regulations of this article, having due regard for the property rights of the persons affected, the public welfare, and the character of the surrounding areas. The nonconforming fencing which lawfully existed at the time of the passage of this article may be continued until a certificate of occupancy is required for the structure or property for which the fence is located. At such time of certificate of occupancy is required for the structure or property, the fence will be required to meet all criteria in this chapter within one year from the date the certificate of occupancy is issued. 
(Ord. No. 57-2013, § 1, 10-14-13) 
Secs. 14-453-14-460. - Reserved. 
Chapter 15 - SUBSTANDARD BUILDINGS AND STRUCTURES/PROPERTY MAINTENANCE CODE[1] 
Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Editor's note- Section 2 of Ord. No. 43-2012 states the following: "This Ordinance shall be cumulative of all provisions of ordinances of the City of Oak Ridge North, Texas, except where the provisions of this Ordinance are in direct conflict with the provisions of such ordinances, in which event the conflicting provisions of such ordinances are hereby repealed. To the extent that the provisions of the City of Oak Ridge North, Texas' various development ordinances conflict with the Ordinance, the terms of this Ordinance shall control. To the extent that the provisions of the Texas Local Government Code Ch. 214 conflict with this Chapter 15, the terms of the Texas Local Government Code shall control." 
Cross reference- Buildings and building regulations, ch. 14; businesses, ch. 18; environment, ch. 34; fire prevention and protection, ch. 38; floods, ch. 42; signs, ch. 74; utilities, ch. 82; zoning, app. A; board of adjustment, app. A, § 17. 
State Law reference- Dangerous structures, V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 214.001 et seq. 

ARTICLE I. - SUBSTANDARD BUILDINGS AND STRUCTURES 

Sec. 15-1. - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    Building means any structure designed or built for the support, enclosure, shelter or protection of persons, animals, chattels or property of any kind. 
    Structure means anything constructed or erected which requires location on the ground or is attached to something having a location on the ground, including but not limited to signs, fences, walls, poles and buildings, whether of a temporary or permanent nature. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Cross reference- Definitions generally, § 1-2. 
Sec. 15-2. - Violation of article; penalty. 
    Any person who refuses or fails to repair or demolish a building or structure when ordered to repair or demolish such building or structure under the terms of this article, or who refuses or fails to leave a building which has been ordered vacated under the terms of this article, or who enters an area around such building that has been declared to be dangerous and notice of which declaration shall have been posted, or who interferes with or hinders the repair, vacation or demolition of any building under the terms of this article, or who otherwise violates any provisions of this article or any order of the city council as provided for in this article, shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction thereof shall be subject to a fine in an amount not to exceed $2,000.00, and each day in which any violation shall occur, or each occurrence of any violation, shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-3. - Court action for enforcement of article. 
    It shall be the duty of the city attorney or attorney for the city to enforce the orders of the city council under this article, when authorized, by bringing an action in a court of competent jurisdiction. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-4. - Conditions constituting substandard building or structure. 
    Any building or structure which has any of the following defects shall be deemed a substandard building or structure and constitute a hazard to the health, safety and welfare of the citizens: 
(1)  Any building or structure that has become deteriorated or damaged through exposure to the elements, including, without limitation, flood, wind, hail or rain, or damage through fire, or damage by any other cause, to the extent that either the roof, windows or doors, or portions of the house, building or structure which protect from the weather, will no longer reasonably protect from the weather. 
(2)  Any building or structure which is so structurally deteriorated or damaged that it is in danger of collapse, or which cannot be expected to withstand reasonably anticipated storms or hurricanes. 
(3)  Any building used for the occupancy of one or more persons which is not connected to an approved public sanitary sewer or does not provide connection to a properly installed and approved septic system. 
(4)  Any building or structure not constructed or maintained in conformity with the International Fire Code or the International Property Maintenance Code when such nonconformity constitutes a hazard to the safety of persons or property. 
(5)  Any building or structure not wired in conformity with the National Electrical Code of the city when such nonconformity constitutes a hazard to the safety of persons or property. 
(6)  Any building or structure not constructed in conformity with the International Plumbing Code of the city when such nonconformity constitutes a hazard to the safety of persons or property. 
(7)  Any building or structure not constructed in conformity with the International Building Code of the city when such nonconformity constitutes a hazard to the safety of persons or property. 
(8)  Any building or structure so constructed or maintained as to constitute a menace to health or safety, including: 
a.  All conditions conducive to the harboring of rats, snakes, mice or other disease-carrying animals, or insects reasonably calculated to spread disease; 
b.  Conditions hazardous to the safety of persons or property, such as inadequate bracing, structural support or construction, or the presence of deteriorated materials; or 
c.  Conditions constituting an attractive nuisance creating a hazard to the health or safety of minors. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-5. - Declaration of nuisance. 
    All substandard buildings or structures within the provisions of this article which shall constitute a hazard to the health, safety or general welfare of the occupants, to the citizens of the city or to the public are declared to be public nuisances and shall be ordered to be repaired, vacated or demolished as provided in this article. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-6. - Inspections and reports. 
    It shall be the duty of the city building official, or other representative designated by the city council, to inspect all buildings or structures reported to be or believed to be substandard, to present a report of such inspection to the city council, and to give notice of the intention of the city council to hold hearings and follow the procedures provided in this article. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-7. - Administrative procedures for issuance of orders. 
    Substandard buildings or structures may be ordered to be and pursuant to order shall be repaired, vacated or demolished under the following conditions, regulations and procedures: 
(1)  Emergency measures. When there exists an emergency as defined in subsection (1)a. of this section, certain measures may be taken, notification given and procedures followed as set forth in this subsection: 
a.  Authorized actions. When it shall appear that a building or structure in the city is a substandard building or structure under the terms of this article and that such building or structure or the manner of its use constitutes an immediate danger to life or property, the condition shall be deemed a hazard justifying the use of emergency measures, and the city council may order any of the following emergency measures to be taken: 
1.  Immediate vacation of such building or structure or adjoining buildings or structures. 
2.  Vacation of the danger area around such building or structure. 
3.  Such temporary emergency shoring and bracing of walls, roofs and supports as are required to eliminate the immediate threat of damage to life or property. 
4.  The demolition of such walls, roofs and supports, or the entire building or structure, or so much thereof as cannot be safely braced or made secure. 
5.  Posting of notices on or near such building or structure, notifying the public of such orders and ordering all persons to keep out of such building or structure and the surrounding areas of danger. 
b.  Notice to owner; hearing. 
1.  When any of such emergency measures are ordered to be taken, notice of such order shall be given by personal service on the owner and occupant of the building or structure or his representatives, or, if such premises are unoccupied, by attaching a copy of such notice in a place of prominence on such building or structure and causing a copy of such notice to be mailed to the owner or his representative by certified mail, return receipt requested, and by regular mail. Upon the adoption of such emergency order the city council shall schedule a public hearing and cite the owner or his representative to appear and show cause why such building or structure should not be declared a substandard building or structure and why he should not be ordered to repair, vacate or demolish such building or structure. Such citation shall be served with the notice of emergency order in accordance with the provisions of this subsection. Such hearing shall be conducted in accordance with the provisions of subsection (2) of this section. If such notification would create such a delay as would materially increase the hazard to life or property, then such notice need not be given. 
2.  If such notice is given and the owner or his representative shall refuse or fail to carry out the orders of the city council or shall fail to carry out such order satisfactorily, then in either such event the city may proceed to carry out such orders either by private contract or by having the city perform the work, and the cost thus incurred shall constitute a valid lien against the property so repaired. 
(2)  Normal procedure. 
a.  When it shall come to the attention of the city council that a building or structure in the city is substandard under the provisions of this article, the city council may schedule a public hearing and cite the owner of the building or structure or his representative to appear and show cause why such building or structure should not be declared to be a substandard building or structure and why he should not be ordered to repair, vacate or demolish the building or structure. The date of such hearing shall be not less than ten days after such citation shall have been made. 
b.  Such citation shall include a statement that the owner will be required to submit at the hearing proof of the scope of any work that may be required to comply with this article and the time it will take to reasonably perform the work. 
c.  Such citation may be served by delivery of a copy thereof to the owner and occupant, or, if such premises are unoccupied, by attaching a copy of such citation in a place of prominence on such building or structure and causing a copy of such citation to be mailed to the owner or his representative by certified mail, return receipt requested, and by regular mail. 
d.  On the day set in such citation the hearing shall be conducted, and on the basis of such hearing the city council shall determine whether or not the building or structure is a substandard building or structure, and shall issue such orders as shall appear reasonably necessary to prevent the building or structure from being a hazard to life or property and to eliminate the substandard qualities. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-8. - Standards for orders. 
    The following standards may be followed by the city council in ordering the repair, vacation or demolition of a substandard building or structure: 
(1)  If the substandard building or structure can reasonably be repaired so that it will no longer be in a condition which is in violation of the provisions of this article, it shall be ordered repaired. 
(2)  If the substandard building or structure is in such condition as to make it dangerous to the health, morals, safety or general welfare of its occupants, to the citizens of the city or to the public, it shall be ordered to be vacated. 
(3)  In any case where a substandard building or structure cannot be repaired so that its existence will no longer be in violation of the provisions of this article, it shall be demolished. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-9. - Failure to comply with order; remedial action by city. 
(a)  After the hearing provided for in this article, if the building or structure is found to be substandard, the city council may direct that the building or structure be repaired or removed within a reasonable time as provided in V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 214.001. If the owner does not take the ordered action within the allotted time, the city shall make a diligent effort to discover each mortgagee and lienholder having an interest in the building or in the property on which the building is located. The city shall send to each identified mortgagee and lienholder a notice containing: 
(1)  An identification, which is not required to be a legal description, of the building and the property on which it is located; 
(2)  A description of the violation of city standards that is present at the building; and 
(3)  A statement that the city will vacate, secure, remove or demolish the building or relocate the occupants of the building if the ordered action is not taken within a reasonable time. 
(4)  As an alternative, the city may take the actions described in V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 214.001(e). 
(b)  Within ten days after the date that the order is issued, the city shall: 
(1)  File a copy of the order in the office of the city secretary; and 
(2)  Publish in a newspaper of general circulation in the city a notice containing: 
a.  The street address or legal description of the property; 
b.  The date of the hearing; 
c.  A brief statement indicating the results of the order; and 
d.  Instructions stating where a complete copy of the order may be obtained. 
(c)  After the hearing, the city shall promptly mail by certified mail, return receipt requested, a copy of the order to the owner of the building, and if the owner does not take the ordered action within the allotted time the city shall promptly mail by certified mail, return receipt requested, a copy of the order to any lienholder or mortgagee of the building. The city shall use the records in the office of the county clerk to determine, if possible, the identity and address of any owner, lienholder or mortgagee of the building. 
(d)  If such repair or removal has not been made at the expiration of the allotted time, the city may repair or demolish and remove the building or structure at the expense of the city and assess the expenses, together with interest to accrue until such expenses are repaid, by filing a lien on the land on which the building or structure stood or to which it was attached. 
(e)  Notice of the assessment of the lien shall be signed in the name of the city by the mayor or city manager. It shall state that the city council has ordered or directed the removal of a building or structure determined to be substandard, after notice to the owner and public hearing in accordance with the ordinances of the city, and that the failure of the owner to remove such substandard building or structure has resulted in the removal thereof at the expense of the city, which expense has been assessed, together with interest, by the city council on the land on which the building or structure stood or to which it was attached. Such notice shall further designate and describe the property against which the lien is assessed and the amount of the assessment. 
(f)  Such notice shall be filed with the county clerk with a copy served on the owner of such property or his representative by personal service or by certified mail, return receipt requested, and regular mail. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Secs. 15-10-15-15. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - PROPERTY MAINTENANCE CODE 
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 

Secs. 15-16-15-25. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - PROPERTY MAINTENANCE CODE 

Sec. 15-26. - Provisions applicable to all properties. 
    The provisions of this code shall apply to all existing residential and nonresidential structures and all premises with or without improvements. The provisions are intended to protect the public health, safety and welfare by providing minimum standards for existing structures, equipment and facilities for light, ventilation, space, heating, sanitation, protection from the elements, life safety, safety from fire and other hazards, and for safe and sanitary maintenance of properties. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-27. - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    Code official means the building official of the city having the duty to enforce the regulations contained in this article. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-28. - International Property Maintenance Code adopted. 
(a)  International Property Maintenance Code. The International Property Maintenance Code, 2009 Edition, including all appendices, as published by the International Code Council, a copy of which is incorporated by reference herein and made a part hereof for all purposes, an authentic copy of which has been filed with the city secretary, is hereby adopted and made a part of this Code. 
(b)  The building official shall periodically review amendments to the International Property Maintenance Code as published by the International Code Council, and may recommend the adoption of such amendments to the city council. The building official may also recommend other local amendments to the International Property Maintenance Code. Local amendments to the International Property Maintenance Code shall be adopted by ordinance and shall control over any conflicting provisions of the International Property Maintenance Code. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12) 
Sec. 15-29. - Amendments to the International Property Maintenance Code. 
    The International Property Maintenance Code adopted in section 15-28 is amended as follows: 
(a)  Section 103.5 is hereby amended to read as follows: 
103.5 Fee Schedule. The fees for permits required hereunder shall be in accordance with the schedule of fees as established from time to time by the City Council of the City of Oak Ridge North. 
(Ord. No. 43-2012, § 1, 11-19-12)

ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Secs. 18-1-18-25. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - SEXUALLY ORIENTED BUSINESSES[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
State Law reference- Authority of city to regulate sexually oriented business, V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 243.001 et seq. 

Sec. 18-26. - Authority. 
(a)  This chapter is adopted pursuant to and in conformity with V.T.C.A., Local Government Code ch. 243, as amended. 
(b)  It is the purpose of the city council to exercise its police power, as established under V.T.C.A., Local Government Code ch. 243 to establish reasonable and uniform regulation of sexually oriented businesses to promote and protect the health, safety and general welfare of the citizens of the city and to prohibit business activities which merely serve as a front for activities prohibited by the Texas Penal Code, including but not limited to, prostitution and the promotion of prostitution. 
(c)  The provisions of these regulations have neither the intent nor the effect of imposing limits or restrictions on the content of any communicative material, including sexually oriented material; nor is it the intent or effect of this regulation to restrict or deny adults access to sexually oriented material protected by the First Amendment. 
(d)  These regulations do not legalize anything prohibited under the Texas Penal Code or any other law or regulation. 
(Ord. No. 06-2013, § 1, 2-11-13) 
Sec. 18-27. - Administration. 
(a)  The city council hereby designates and directs the city manager or his/her designee(s) to investigate, deny, issue, attach conditions, suspend and revoke sexually oriented business permits (SOBPs) pursuant to the above authority and these regulations. By interlocal agreement, the city council may contract with the Commissioners Court of Montgomery County for administration of the provisions of this chapter. In the event of such interlocal agreement, the county official designated pursuant to such agreement shall exercise the powers and duties of the administrator under this chapter. 
(b)  Pursuant to V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 243.007(c), the district court has jurisdiction over a suit which arises from the denial, suspension or revocation of a SOBP by the city. 
(c)  A violation of these regulations is a Class A misdemeanor. 
(d)  The revocation or suspension of a SOBP shall not prohibit the imposition of a criminal penalty and the imposition of a criminal penalty shall not prevent the revocation or suspension of a SOBP pursuant to these regulations. 
(Ord. No. 06-2013, § 1, 2-11-13) 
Sec. 18-28. - Area covered by regulations. 
    These regulations apply to enterprises located within the corporate limits of the city. Such enterprises shall be subject to and must comply with all zoning regulations as designated by the planning and zoning commission. 
(Ord. No. 06-2013, § 1, 2-11-13; Ord. No. 21-2014, § 6, 3-24-14) 
Sec. 18-29. - Definitions. 
    Administrator means the city manager of the City of Oak Ridge North, Texas, his or her designated agent or the county official authorized by interlocal agreement to perform the duties of the administrator. 
    Adult arcade shall mean any premises that is subject to regulation under V.T.C.A., Local Government Code ch. 243, as amended, to which members of the public or members of any club, group or association are admitted and permitted to use one or more arcade devices on the premises. 
    Adult bookstore or adult video store means an establishment that as its primary business purpose offers for sale or rental, for any form of consideration, any one or more of the following: 
(1)  Books, magazines, periodicals or other printed matter, photographs, films, motion pictures, video cassettes or video reproductions, computer programs, slides or other visual representations that depict or describe specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas as defined in this section, and 
(2)  Instruments, devices or paraphernalia that are designed for use in connection with specified sexual activities as defined in this section. 
    Adult cabaret means a nightclub, bar, restaurant, or similar commercial establishment that features: 
(1)  Persons who appear semi-nude or in a state of nudity as defined in this section; 
(2)  Live performances which are characterized by the exposure of specified anatomical areas or specified sexual activities as defined in this section; and 
(3)  Films, motion pictures, computer simulations, video cassettes, slides or other reproductions which are characterized by the depiction or description of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas as defined in this section. 
    Adult motel means a hotel, motel or similar commercial establishment that: 
(1)  Offers accommodations to the public for any form of consideration and provides patrons with closed-circuit television transmission, films, motion pictures, video cassettes, slides or other reproductions which are characterized by the depiction or description of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas as defined herein; and 
(2)  Offers a sleeping room for rent for a period of time that is less than ten hours or allows a tenant or occupant of a sleeping room to sublease the room for a period of time that is less than ten hours. 
    Adult motion picture theater means a commercial establishment that regularly shows, for any form of consideration, films, motion pictures, video cassettes, slides or similar photographic reproductions which are characterized by the depiction or description of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas as defined in this section. 
    Adult theater means a theater, concert hall, auditorium or similar commercial establishment that regularly features live performances characterized by the exposure of specified anatomical areas defined in this section. 
    Allow means to let happen, cause, suffer, or permit, including the failure to prevent. 
    Applicant means the individual or entity submitting the application for a SOBP. Where appropriate, this includes a designated agent of the applicant. 
    Arcade device shall mean any coin- or slug-operated or electronically or mechanically controlled machine or device that dispenses or effectuates the dispensing of entertainment, that is intended for the viewing of five or fewer persons in exchange for any payment of any consideration. Arcade device shall also mean an anthropomorphic device or object that is utilized for entertainment with one or more persons. 
    Cashier means any employee who handles cash or any other form of payment from clients of any enterprise for services or products provided. 
    Child care facility means a facility used as a day nursery, children's boarding home, child placement agency or other place for the care or custody of children under 15 years of age, licensed by the state pursuant to V.T.C.A., Human Resource Code ch. 42. 
    Church or place of religious worship means a facility, including all structures and grounds, at which persons regularly assemble for worship, intended primarily for the purposes connected with faith or for propagating a particular form of belief. 
    City means the City of Oak Ridge North, Texas, or its officers, employees or authorized agents. 
    City council means the governing body of the City of Oak Ridge North. 
    County means Montgomery County, Texas. 
    Dwelling means a house, duplex, apartment, townhouse, condominium, mobile home or any other building used as a residence. 
    Employee means any person who works in or about an enterprise and renders any service whatsoever to the patrons of an enterprise and receives compensation for such service or work for the enterprise operator or owner of the enterprise or from the patrons thereof excepting individuals who have a valid Class II SOBP working at the enterprise under a written contract. 
    Enterprise means a sexually oriented business enterprise consisting of the primary business of which is the offering of a service or the selling, renting or exhibiting of devices or any other items intended to provide sexual stimulation or sexual gratification to the customer. This definition includes but is not limited to sex parlors, nude studios, modeling studios, love parlors, adult bookstores, adult movie theaters, adult video arcades, adult movie arcades, adult video stores, adult motels, adult cabarets, escort agencies, and sexual encounter centers. 
(1)  Enterprises are classified as follows: 
a.  Class I enterprises conduct business regularly at a specific location. 
b.  Class II enterprises are individuals who offer, for tips, salary, or other compensation, a service intended to provide sexual stimulation or sexual gratification to patrons at any location in the county, unless that individual is any employee of a Class I enterprise working at the location permitted under a Class I SOBP. 
(2)  The term enterprise shall not be construed to include: 
a.  A business operated by or employing licensed psychologists, licensed physical therapists, licensed athletic trainers, licensed cosmetologists, or licensed barbers that, as the major business purpose, performs functions authorized under the license held; 
b.  Any business operated by or employing licensed physicians or licensed chiropractors engaged in practicing the healing arts as the major business purpose; 
c.  A massage establishment which is properly registered under Chapter 752, Acts of the 69th Legislature, Regular Session, 1985 (Article 4512K, Vernon's Texas Civil Statutes), as amended; 
d.  A bookstore, movie theater or video store, unless that business is an adult bookstore, adult movie theater, or adult video store as defined in these regulations; 
e.  A theater, concert hall, auditorium or similar commercial establishment unless that business is an adult theater as defined in these regulations; or 
f.  A tanning facility that is properly licensed pursuant V.T.C.A., Health and Safety Code ch. 145, the Tanning Facility Act, as amended by the Acts of 1995, 74th Legislature, Ch. 684. 
    Enterprise operator means an administrator or other natural person principally in charge of a sexually oriented business enterprise. 
    Entertainment shall mean: 
(1)  Any live exhibition, display or performance; or 
(2)  Any still picture(s) or movie picture(s), whether mechanically, electrically or electronically displayed; or 
(3)  Any combination of the foregoing, in which the specified anatomical areas or specified sexual activities are depicted; or 
(4)  Use of an arcade device for any specified sexual activities. 
    Escort means an individual who, for consideration, agrees or offers to privately model, dance or similarly perform for another person, or to act as a private companion, guide or date for another person and offers a service intended to provide sexual stimulation or sexual gratification to the customer. 
    Escort agency means a business that, for consideration, furnishes, offers to furnish or advertises to furnish escorts as one of its primary business purposes and offers a service intended to provide sexual stimulation or sexual gratification to the customer. 
    Hospital means a building used to provide in-patient medical care for the sick or injured and licensed pursuant to the Texas Health and Safety Code, or operated by an agency of the federal government. 
    Interested party means any person who owns or leases real property within 1,500 feet of an enterprise, any official who is elected by residents of Montgomery County, and the applicant. 
    Live exhibition means a live performance by one or more individuals conducted in front of at least one patron, including but not limited to, dancing, modeling, sword swallowing, juggling, acrobatic acts, wrestling and pantomime. 
    Nude means: 
(1)  Entirely unclothed; or 
(2)  Clothed in a manner that leaves uncovered or visible through less than fully opaque clothing any portion of the breasts below the top of the areola of the breasts, if the person is female, or any portion of the genitals or buttocks. 
    Nudity or state of nudity means any state of dress which fails to opaquely cover a human buttock, anus, male genitalia, female genitalia or areola of a female breast. 
    Patron means any customer or client of an enterprise, including members of the public or club members invited or admitted to a Class I enterprise. This definition shall not include the employees or permitted Class II performers at a Class I enterprise. 
    Person means an individual, partnership, corporation, association or other legal entity. 
    Public building means a building used by federal, state or local government that is open to the general public. 
    Public park means a tract of land dedicated for public use and accessible to the general public for recreational purposes, not including public roads, walkways, easements and rights-of-way. This term shall include locations owned by non-profit organizations that provide educational and recreational facilities. 
    Regulations means regulations of the city for the operations of sexually oriented business enterprises. 
    SOBP means sexually oriented business permit issued and regulated pursuant to this regulation. 
    School means a facility, including all attached playgrounds, dormitories, stadiums and other appurtenances which are part of the facility, used for the primary purpose of instruction or education, including primary and secondary schools, colleges and universities, both public and private. 
    Semi-nude means any state of dress which opaquely covers no more than a human buttock, anus, male genitalia, female genitalia or areola of a female breast. 
    Server means an individual who serves patrons food or beverages in an enterprise, including waiters, waitresses, hosts, hostesses and bartenders. 
    Sexually oriented modeling studio means a place where for any form of consideration, a person models semi-nude or in a state of nudity, or displays specified anatomical areas as defined in this section, for other persons to sketch, draw, paint, sculpt, photograph or similarly depict or observe. 
    Specified anatomical areas means human genitals in a state of sexual arousal, whether clothed or nude. 
    Specified sexual activities means any of the following: 
(1)  Fondling or other erotic touching of human genitals, pubic region, buttocks, anus or female breasts, whether clothed or nude. 
(2)  Sex acts, actual or simulated, including intercourse, oral copulation, or sodomy.
